result.execSummary:
The defendant Bradley J. McKittrick was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With huber privileges.  DNA sample to be provided.  TIME SERVED

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bradley J. McKittrick

records.addlTxt:
1:04 PM Defendant Bradley J. McKittrick in court.  Attorney Annie E Getsinger in court for Bradley J. McKittrick.  Attorney Gabriel David Arevalo in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim notification done.  VIS filed.  DE completed treatment upfront.  State gives recommendation.  Atty. Getsinger echoes the State's recommendation. Court imposes sentence.

Count 1:
$543.00 costs, 60 days to pay or set up a payment plan with Sauk Co. Clerk of Courts.
1 Day in Sauk County Jail, with huber, consecutive. TIME SERVED
1 day credit
Provide DNA Sample
Paperwork handed in court.
Sentencing hearing on September 23, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Telephone scheduling conference on July 20, 2022 at 08:00 am.

1:29 PM Defendant Bradley J. McKittrick in court.  Attorney Annie E Getsinger in court for Bradley J. McKittrick.  Attorney Gabriel David Arevalo in court for State of Wisconsin.  Atty Getsinger advises parties have been in negotiations and have reached a resolution that DE is hoping to accept; however, requires up front work from DE.  Atty Getsinger proposes filing a waiver of right to a jury trial.  DE has an assessment set up in 2 days.  Atty Getsinger recommends setting a TSC to schedule plea and sentencing.  Off the record at 1:33 p.m.  Victim notification has been met and there is a VIS to be filed upon sentencing.  Court suggests a plea hearing today.  Recess at 1:34 p.m.  Back on the record at 1:40 p.m.  NCP entered, advised of const. rights, plea accepted by Ct.  Ct. finds Def. guilty.  To be set for TSC in about 30 to 45 days.  Bond continues.
of intent to introduce statement, confession or admission

Final pre-trial on June 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Hearing on June 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Motion hearing on June 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial on June 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Telephone scheduling conference on March 21, 2022 at 08:45 am.

01:55 PM Attorney Annie E Getsinger in court.  Emily Eklund appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and appearances.  Atty Getsinger stands mute.  Court enters not guilty plea(s) - set for TSC in about 60 days.  Bond continued.
